method.text: Before starting, determine your scaling by calculating how many ladyfingers you need to create a complete layer in your dish. Decide whether you want 2 or 3 layers of ladyfingers. Ensure there are no gaps in the layers. Note that soaked ladyfingers expand slightly, so perform a dry fit beforehand and add about 10% more to account for this
Make the coffee and leave it to cool
Whip the egg yolks with the sugar until pale and thick (see video )

Add in mascarpone and beat until it reaches firm peaks stage (see video ). Start at low speed, moving up to medium, and expect this to take quite a few minutes. If you overbeat, it will eventually curdle, but don't be scared
Dunk the ladyfingers in the coffee. You should use it all, and each finger should get the same amountx
Spread half of the mascarpone cream evenly over the ladyfingers
Create another layer using the remaining 30 coffee-dipped ladyfingers, then spread the remaining mascarpone cream on top
Sift cocoa powder generously over the mascarpone layer
Store in the fridge until ready to serve, ideally 8 to hours

notes.text: Coffee volume is an estimate, increased 20% from the previous effort (9g per ladyfinger) which left the biscuits slightly too dry

title: Tiramisu
intro: Based on the original Tiramisu recipe from Le Beccherie Restaurant, but with reduced sugar as it turns out way too sweet

source.text: Original recipe by Le Beccherie Restaurant
